Comments_List: Better understanding of mechanism design, contracting, and information design. A deeper understanding of some current work in microeconomics and game theory.

The course was well structured within units. There wasn't much crossover between different sections, but I don't think that was a problem. It may have been helpful to have more stringent requirements on reading papers, either by having more class discussions or by assuming a familiarity with notation/basics before class. This could have allowed more material to be covered and would be a way to increase the workload without just writing more problem sets (which would also be fine).
